review.itemreviewed: Organic Cotton French Terry Hoodie - Women's
review.reviewBody:
It looks like cozy thick cotton but it’s just a thin toss-on jacket.. it looks funny when it’s unzipped too. But once I accepted that it’s just different than I expected, I do like it. It’s still comfy and can be cute too. 
Runs small on me but maybe I need to remember to size up in women’s jackets because I have broad shoulders for a woman.
review.name: Thought it would be cozier

review.itemreviewed: Organic Cotton French Terry Hoodie - Women's
review.reviewBody: I really wanted to love this jacket - I love Patagonia, but this is just poorly built.  Within a few months there were already a few holes throughout the jacket - and I was only wearing this at work or lounging at home.  Then the zipper and the mechanism on the opposite side completely fell off.  I love how lightweight it is and maybe mine was just defective, but definitely not the quality I am used to from Patagonia.
review.name: Holes and Broken Zipper

name: Organic Cotton French Terry Hoodie - Women's

review.itemreviewed: Anacapa 2 Low GTX Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Good looking shoes that fit well and that are comfortable.
review.name: Very Comfortable Shoes

review.itemreviewed: Anacapa 2 Low GTX Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I have had these shoes for nearly an hour now and they fell great sitting on my lap after driving home! Will buy them again
review.name: Super!

review.itemreviewed: Anacapa 2 Low GTX Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Section hiking/backpacking Colorado Trail. Great shows for cushion, water resistance, no blisters
review.name: Yes, best hiking shoes

review.itemreviewed: Anacapa 2 Low GTX Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Hoka finally aced it. I was waiting for the wide version. It is fantastic. Comfortable. FYI, it feels larger than 13 size. But it is ok if you are hiking for long distances to manage the swelling of the feet. Goretex is definitely a plus. Height is perfect. The heel area is very comfortable. The only thing I can't evaluate and I have doubts about it is how long will it last. Hopefully my expectation is wrong.
review.name: I would buy these shoes again

review.itemreviewed: Anacapa 2 Low GTX Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: My travel experience was very comfortable with my new anacapa 2 low gtx perfect for wear. Smooth and soft waking.
review.name: 100% recommended

review.itemreviewed: Anacapa 2 Low GTX Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I'm a letter carrier. I need good reliable walking/hiking sneakers. I know people have been raving about Hokas so I took a chance. I've been wearing them for about a month. Despite the waterproof claim, my toes get wet just walking through wet grass, granted I walk through alot of wet grass. I walk 4 to 7 miles a day. Also the material at the ankle dip is already starting to fray. They are indeed very comfortable and light and a pleasure to walk in otherwise and were a perfect fit at first try. Probably would not buy again, need to find some actual waterproof shoes.
review.name: Was hoping for better quality

review.itemreviewed: Anacapa 2 Low GTX Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Love the color combination. Difficult shoe to fit my foot. To get the right length)mens 9.5), the shoe feels a little wide in the ball area. While the men's size 9 felt just right in width in the ball area, crested some pressure in the big toe area of the right foot.
review.name: I would it this item again!

review.itemreviewed: Anacapa 2 Low GTX Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: These are really nice shoes, sturdy, comfortable, all the things you love about Hoka. I really like the olive color. All that said, still deciding if I will keep them or return them due to sizing. I have owned a dozen Hokas over the years. A size 12.5, normal width, has been perfect for all of them until now. As others have noted, this shoe seems a bit larger / looser than others. There is a lot of play in the heel area and it sometimes feels like you will walk right out of them. I suspect that a half size down on this model might be the right answer. I am concerned that on a long hike that the loose feel might be problematic on lgravel, over rocky terrain, etc. I will give them another day or 2 to decide.
review.name: Nice shoe, but looser fit than other Hokas

review.itemreviewed: Anacapa 2 Low GTX Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: This my favorite pair of shoes so far, I use this shoes for hiking. Very comfortable.
review.name: Best shoes

review.itemreviewed: Anacapa 2 Low GTX Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I've had three pair of Hoka running shoes and the size has always been consistent. I ordered the same size for the Anacapa hiking shoes and they are fully 1/2 size too big. Tried to return for a smaller size but they are out of stock. Hoka was great in issuing a refund, but disappointing because they look like a great shoe.
review.name: Bigger Than Other Hoka's

name: Anacapa 2 Low GTX Hiking Shoe - Men's

review.reviewBody: This is my second pair. Although I love them I think the sole grip could be less slippery on snow and ice.
review.name: A bit slippery but otherwise great and warm

review.reviewBody: I've had mine for over a year and they still are my top tier hikers. The versatile material works in all climates except the snow of course. My feet are never sad when tromping around the terrain of Eastern Washington State..
review.name: Happy feet
comment: Thanks for sharing your great feedback!

review.reviewBody: This is my wife's first pair of Moab's and she really liked them from the first time she put them on. The low rise version is a great choice for local park hikes where ankle protection isn't strongly needed but better traction and comfort are desirable.
review.name: Great first pair for my wife.

review.reviewBody: Great shoes (the Moab 3) very comfortable and made to last - Feel secure wearing these
review.name: MERRELL ALWAYS !

review.reviewBody: I bought these shoes for me and my girlfriend and we love the. I'm usually a 7.5 and ordered an 8 and I love the extra room. The shoes are super comfortable, and the tops of my feet feel like they're cuddled by a cloud. The shoes have an amazing grip to them that I'm really impressed with. I used them to hike at Pinnacles National Park and walked on steep graveled terrain without slipping once! I have only used them in dry conditions, and don't plan to use them in the snow or in the rain. Additionally, the shoes are light so it doesn't feel like I'm sacrificing much with wearing these Merrells over my trail runners. Would definitely recommend these shoes!
review.name: Excellent comfort and grip
comment: Thank you for sharing your awesome feedback!

review.reviewBody: I love these shoes and not only wear them for hiking but also for just walking and even shopping! They’re warm, comfortable and rugged. Plus they look good!
review.name: All Around Good

review.reviewBody: Super comfortable and they have great grip, would recommend!
review.name: Very Comfortable

review.reviewBody: Very good shoes for trail walks. Fit well immediately
review.name: Grand walking and hiking ahoe

review.reviewBody: These are my favorite shoes ever, I have 3 pairs. Best foot support and comfort I’ve found, not just as a hiking shoe but to wear all the time. True to size as well.

comment: Thanks for the great feedback Caitlin! Being your favorite is our favorite!

review.reviewBody:
I wished I read the comments with low rating before buying this pair. I really love the appearence and they are so light but even I size up the pair still didn't fit. 

After using them for a couple of hours my toes were in pain. Will recomend to try this pair in the store.
review.name: Didn't fit true to size

review.reviewBody: I've gotten to wear these a few times and they are nice and light. Also fit great right out of the box. True to size 8.5. I would buy this brand again.
review.name: Nice show so far.

review.reviewBody: Attractive shoes and very comfortable. Love!
review.name: Get 'em!

review.reviewBody: These are super comfortable, even though the toes are not very precise. Size .5 or 1 down from street, I wear a 9.5 women’s and I could have used an 8.5 or 9 women’s. I wear socks to make up for it and they’re fine. Otherwise great construction and super convenient!
review.name: Great for bouldering and belaying

review.reviewBody: These shoes are very comfortable and I appreciate the ability to slide on without pulling the back lip up. It's still comfortable to be worn like that and they are very lightweight. Have not worn on longer approaches yet but think they will hold up great!
review.name: Comfortable and lightweight

review.reviewBody: This is my second pair and love these session shoes! Perfect fit, comfy and quick on/offs!
review.name: Perfect approach shoe!

review.reviewBody: I absolutely love these shoes. The look good and are comfortable. I wear the walking around town, to work, and at the crag. I have even climbed low level climbs in them with no issue. I’m considering a second pair.
review.name: I’m in Love!

review.reviewBody:
Wow, the most comfortable and stickiest approach shoes I've ever owned. 

The footbed is very pliable, which is unusual for approach shoes, but the rubber is super sticky so it's perfect for desert slick rock. 

I am wondering whether these shoes will hold up to the beating compared to my LaSportivas, but I am willing take the tradeoff of comfort over sturdiness.
review.name: Super comfortable, sticky soles

review.reviewBody: Had these shoes for myself (male) for about 6 months and absolutely loved them, had to buy them for my wife and she absolutely loves them! Lightweight yet sturdy. Love that you can wear them like slippers. The mesh lets your feet breath which is much needed when my sweaty smelly feet. Will buy again and again.
review.name: Excellent

review.reviewBody: These have become my go-to everyday shoes and they are awesome! So comfortable.
review.name: So comfy!

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I was looking for an extra stiff flat shoe to aid in climbing and this shoe seems to work well. Not only pretty stiff but sticks to the pedals very well. I dont think there is a stiffer flat shoe out there, and I am happy with the Freerider Pros all around goodness.

Fit is also where it should be. If you are in between sizes, I would size up a half size to be safe.
review.name: Good looking shoe with great grip and a stiff sole

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Very solid flat shoe. Warm in the winter acceptable in the summer.  Engages with the pedals super well.   These are my third pair in 8 years.
review.name: Great flat pedal shoe

review.reviewBody: They are good looking shoes. Son picked these shoes out
review.name: This is a Christmas gift. But my son picked these

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Awesome firm cycling shoes. Used them for a century ride. Comfortable and excellent grip for my pedals.
review.name: Gave up clipping in with these shoes!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Love this shoe EXCEPT that the tongue always goes towards the outside of the shoe. Big toe box is a plus as is the rigidity of what's beneath my foot - helps on bigger drops. If it helps, I'm on the big side at like 6-6 and 245-250 riding weight. Comes in larger sizes is another plus.
review.name: My go to shoe for flats

review.reviewBody:
I bought these a month ago. They are the fourth pair of Go-form guards I've used. I have elbow and the longer guard for knee and shin. They fit nice and they washable.
I've been riding for close to 20 years and have my share of crashes. These guards have given the protection I've needed.
review.name: Love Go- form knee guards

review.reviewBody: I was looking for something to wear that is breathable in the south Texas heat. I’ve worn them several times in 95+ degree heat and have no complaints. They are very comfortable and I don’t even notice I’m wearing them. I’ve been riding mountain bikes for 35 years and wish I had started wearing them years ago, it would have saved me from a trip to the emergency room and a few stitches in my knee and plenty of lost skin and blood. I highly recommend these pads, especially for older riders like me who don’t bounce as well as we used to.
review.name: Great protection

review.reviewBody: It's comfortable and seems to have lots of protection.   Wore it a whole day at the bike park and they stayed in place.   Haven't tried them on a xc ride.
review.name: So far it's great

review.reviewBody: Bought size M. Fits good and stays well. Saved my knees few times already from scratches. Only issue I have is that label started to peel off immediately. Before I even washed them. It is only a cosmetic issue though. Overall I like it.
review.name: Good protection

review.reviewBody: This is my wife's second set - she loves them. After a couple of crashes she picked these up and never worries about falling anymore. They stay in place and provide some added thermal protection when it's cold.
review.name: Great protection

review.reviewBody: Comfortable and priced nice.  Have not experienced impact with them yet
review.name: Comfortable

review.reviewBody: Great tent but did not hold up like I thought it should when a four wheeler bumped into it. I would like to suggest adding hi viz reflective to the tent so other can see it and not accidentally run into it like mine.
review.name: Didn’t hold up like I thought it would

review.reviewBody: We took this tent up to the Adirondacks ….it rained 3in in one night ….. bone dry …. Excellent tent best they make good job Coleman!!!
review.name: Tent

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This Coleman tent Peak1 3P Backpacking Is Surprisingly beautiful outdoor tent. First I would like to start by saying this is very lightweight . This comes with a carrying bag which is great for camping. Second this comes with everything you need. It has a base,stake,rain cover, buckle, clip and ropes for the sides. I set this up very easy and the rods or pole fit together easily because they are magnetic which makes it easy to work with. This got 2 entrances and I love the Dark stone color scheme. I like the idea of the fine netting that lets the fresh air in while keeping the mosquitoes out.It is a great tent but keep in mind I have not tested it in heavy rain and wind. My only con would be its a bit smaller than what I expected it to be but I'd still give it 5 star because I'm impressed with this outdoor coleman tent that is very easy to assemble and lightweight for outdoors.
review.name: Very Easy to put up tent

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love this tent! Not only was it easy to set up, it fits 2 people in it easily! Easy to carry. It’s not too heavy. It’s perfect for a quick camping trip. My son absolutely LOVED going camping in the yard! He’s excited to actually go camping for the first time this summer!
review.name: Easy to set up

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love this product great for camping it was Ah little hard to put up but once it was up it  nice I'm 6 foot and me and my girlfriend fit in it . Nice touch on the star window and was very spacious to jus be for two people.
review.name: Great

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is just the perfect size. And it doesn't weight that much. It was easy to set up and it is waterproof which is nice. We went camping and it started to rain and we didn't even it cause the tent didn't leak.
review.name: Great Tent

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Such a cool little tent. My nine year old son and I use this to go car camping and in the backyard. It sets up quickly and easily, is big enough for us and our basic gear. It provides great shelter from the winds coming off of Lake Mead
review.name: Perfect!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I am a novice when it comes to outdoor things. Setting up the tent is quick as the instructions are easy to follow. My wife and I slept in this tent for 2 nights for a weekend getaway. The weather here is mild and windy. Inside the tent we didn’t feel the elements! The tent held up well and no gusts came inside. Packing up the tent went much better as the carrying case is very easy to handle. I would recommend this tent to all levels of campersz
review.name: Perfect For Every Outdoor Enthusiast

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] My grandson  always wanting a tent for him and his sister and friend for a long time. I had to help him  put it together and take it down when he was done with it. He really loved it because it’s something different to enjoy . It was simple to use the instructions an easy to follow too. he said he didn’t have a rolling it back up into the bag it came in, but otherwise, everything else worked perfectly. He wanting to use it every weekend now.
review.name: Easy to assemble and take down

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I have the peak1 tent 2 person backpacking. This tent is easy to set up and take down. Easy to put it away after using. The tent is lightweight for transporting. Easy to hike to our camping with this tent.
review.name: Let's camp

name: Peak1 Backpacking Tent: 3-Person 3-Season

description: Buy the Good To-Go Pad Thai - 2 Servings online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Pad Thai - 2 Servings
hasVariant.description: Buy the Good To-Go Pad Thai - 2 Servings online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
After reading mixed reviews on this I figured I'd still give it a go and see for myself what it was like. Obviously, you can't expect it to be like legit pad thai. The noodles are cut into pieces so it packs and cooks better for the backcountry. Overall the flavor was good, but maybe a little more like a curry than a pad thai. It was hearty and super filling compared to most 2 serving freeze dried meals. I couldn't for the life of me finish this and saved the rest as lunch the next day. For reference, I ate this while backpacking 100+ miles on The Highline trail in the Uintas. This was night 5 of 6 and I couldn't eat the whole thing. 

Overall opinion - was fairly good, but I don't see it as something I'd crave on a trip so I probably won't order it again. But if someone offered it to me, I'd eat it!
review.name: IMHO

name: Pad Thai - 2 Servings

hasVariant.name: Maya 3.0 Helmet
hasVariant.description: Buy the Kali Protectives Maya 3.0 Helmet online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
The Kali Maya 3.0 on the other hand, is another story. 

I was given the Kali Maya 3.0 size xs/s as a gift, whether it was because I am notorious for not wearing a brain bucket and we should all try to preserve what brains we have left, or because the individual was just genuinely really nice, I have no idea. I tossed it on as soon as I got it though, because free stuff is awesome. 

The helmet fit like a dream, I am not sure if it's low density layer that my son refers to as the octopus grippers, or the type of padding, or if the individual who's head they modeled this thing after happens to be my long lost twin brother, but once I set it on my head, It disappears. 
I've used it on 40 degree days and now tested it on 87 degree days with no liner in the cold and no excess sweat in the heat! ( I live in Michigan, it was actually all in the same day. hopefully somebody gets that joke)

It's lightweight, ventilated to the nines, and it doesn't make feel like a bobble head. 

The finish on the helmet is on par with my Fox and Poc helmets and it's actually the lightest helmet I own, lighter than my last road helmet in fact. 

I'm not saying this is the nicest helmet ever made, I'm just saying I haven't found one better.
What more could you ask for?
review.name: Helmets can be a pain.

review.reviewBody: I have been wearing the Kali MAYA 3.0 helmet for about a month now on the trails. I really like how you can really customize the fit for your head. With the adjustable chin straps, dial retention straps, and the locking clips to help keep the ear straps from flopping around. The foam is comfortable throughout the whole ride and also dries pretty quickly when wet. The visor has good enough shade from the sun or glare. I would highly recommend this helmet to my friends and family.
review.name: Fit is customizable and comfortable!

review.reviewBody: Comparing this helmet to all the road helmets I have worn.. yes I wear road helmets on the trail too - this helmet gives me a larger feeling of protection, even when you just look at the padding inside. The helmet sits around your head, rather than road helmets sitting on the top of your head. The straps come from the center back of the helmet, rather the sides, giving a snug fit. I have longer hair than most and bushy; this helmet never pulled out any hair in the padding or boa when taking it off. Going off that, it still has space for a pony tail under the boa. As a first trail helmet, the appeal and comfortability support the price point. I would recommend this helmet to someone getting into trial riding.
review.name: First MTB helmet

review.reviewBody:
I really like this helmet. The fit and finish are too notch, and I just looks great. The fabric on the headband is really soft and feel better against my forehead than anything else I have tried. 

The helmet breathes really well in the Phoenix heat. And is light as a feather on a longer ride. 

Why is it not five stars? One, I would prefer a fidlock buckle, is it the end of the world, almost, but they a re nice touch with gloves on. More importantly, it needs a better sweat management system. I hate when brow sweat drips onto my glasses, and this lacks any of the channelling that other buckets have. 

For the price tho, Ill be happy running this helmet for a while.
review.name: Great value

review.reviewBody: I got the Maya in black and really like it! It is super comfy and looks sharp. It has these strips of silicone that looks like it has little suction cups, they help keep the helmet from sliding went I start to sweat. Another feature I loved was the quick release buckle on the chin strap, it made adjusting it so simple. For $130 this helmet is a great value.
review.name: Great Helmet

review.reviewBody: If you're someone who is dipping their toe into riding trail or simply someone who is looking for an incredible value, this is the helmet for you. For the amount of adjustability and overall comfort, this helmet should cost much more. What I like most about the helmet is that once it's dialed in, I forget I'm wearing it. It's super light and ultra-comfortable. The gel on the inside also doesn't absorb sweat like traditional foam inserts.
review.name: Incredible helmet for the price!

review.reviewBody: This helmet has great ventilation and is also very comfortable - the two main things I look for in a good helmet.  On top of that, It also feels nice and light and unobtrusive on rides.  It has an absolutely massive range of adjustment on the dial, which I appreciate as I am often between sizes.  Besides your standard foam padding on the inside of the helmet, it also some gel-like pads built into the inside of the shell.  They really add to the comfort and seem like they'll hold up longer than foam pads.  Overall, its a very nice helmet, especially at this price point.
review.name: Perfect Trail / All Mountain Helmet

name: Maya 3.0 Helmet

review.itemreviewed: R2 TechFace Hooded Fleece Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody:
This is the first negative review I have left for a Patagonia product.  The R2 Techface hoody is not new technology or design.  It is, at best a cheap imitation of those that came before it. 

The Mixmaster hoody came first with original R2 fleece and every technical feature and fit to make it the perfect hybrid hoody for ice and alpine climbing.  Next came the Northwall hoody, also perfect for cold weather days in the cold.

The R2 techface has the weakest fleece lining I have ever seen in a jacket.   The last generation R1 was more durable and warmer.  After only a month of wearing it, the fleece lining is worn and any real insulation is lost.  There is no hem or hood drawstring and no wrist fasteners.  In other words, the jacket will not stay in place when ice climbing.

The Mixmaster could easily be worn climbing in the teens and provide plenty of warmth.  It was the perfect mountain jacket.  The R2 Techface excels …. maybe on a late fall/early spring pub crawl…maybe.  Sorry Patagonia but you really dropped the ball on this one.
review.name: A Cheap Imitation of its Predecessors

review.itemreviewed: R2 TechFace Hooded Fleece Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: Backcountry can't ship stuff on time to save, even when you call and confirm its being shipped.. LIES!! if you need gear for a trip don't use Backcountry you'll be left gearless.. 3 days my overnight order has sit in there warehouse. Thanks a lot!!
review.name: never trust Backcountry!!

review.reviewBody:
Ravager EXO/TR Tire - Clincher: Unleash Your Off-Road Potential

When it comes to conquering challenging off-road terrains, having the right tires is paramount. The Ravager EXO/TR Tire - Clincher is a game-changer in this regard, offering exceptional performance, durability, and versatility. With its aggressive tread pattern, puncture-resistant construction, and superior traction, this tire is a must-have for riders seeking to unleash their off-road potential and tackle any trail with confidence.

One of the standout features of the Ravager EXO/TR Tire - Clincher is its aggressive tread design. The widely spaced knobs and deep, angular edges provide exceptional traction and control on loose and unpredictable surfaces. Whether you're tackling muddy trails, gravel paths, or technical descents, the Ravager's tread pattern digs in and finds grip, allowing you to maintain control and navigate challenging terrains with ease.

Durability is a key factor when it comes to off-road tires, and the Ravager EXO/TR Tire - Clincher doesn't disappoint. It features a robust EXO casing that provides excellent puncture protection without sacrificing weight or performance. The reinforced sidewalls and additional layers of material enhance the tire's resistance to cuts, abrasions, and pinch flats, ensuring that you can ride with confidence even in the harshest conditions.

The versatility of the Ravager EXO/TR Tire - Clincher is another highlight. It excels in a wide range of off-road disciplines, making it suitable for various riding styles and conditions. Whether you're an avid gravel grinder, a dedicated cyclocross racer, or an adventurous trail rider, this tire adapts seamlessly to different surfaces, delivering consistent performance and reliable grip.

Tubeless compatibility is an added bonus with the Ravager EXO/TR Tire - Clincher. The tire features a TR (Tubeless Ready) design, allowing you to enjoy the benefits of lower tire pressures, improved traction, and reduced risk of pinch flats. Setting up the tire tubeless is a straightforward process, and with the right sealant, you can ride confidently without worrying about punctures or flats. The tubeless setup also enhances the tire's overall performance by reducing rolling resistance and increasing sidewall support.

When it comes to ride quality, the Ravager EXO/TR Tire - Clincher delivers a smooth and confident experience. The tire's supple casing absorbs vibrations and small impacts, providing a comfortable ride even on rough terrain. The balanced tread pattern ensures predictable handling and cornering, allowing you to maintain control and confidence through corners and technical sections. The tire's wide profile also provides stability, enhancing your overall riding experience.

Another noteworthy aspect of the Ravager EXO/TR Tire - Clincher is its wide range of available sizes. Whether you prefer narrower options for cyclocross or wider options for gravel adventures, the Ravager offers a size to suit your needs. The availability of different widths allows you to tailor your tire selection based on the specific demands of your riding style and the terrain you'll be tackling.

Mounting the Ravager EXO/TR Tire - Clincher is a straightforward process. The tire's bead conforms easily to the rim, ensuring a secure fit. However, it's worth noting that some riders may find the initial setup slightly more challenging due to the tire's aggressive tread and tubeless compatibility. Taking the time to follow the manufacturer's instructions and using appropriate tools can help ensure a successful and hassle-free installation.

In terms of aesthetics, the Ravager EXO/TR Tire - Clincher exudes a rugged and purposeful look. The aggressive tread pattern and bold sidewall graphics make a statement on your bike, showcasing your off-road intentions. Whether you prefer a classic black sidewall or a vibrant color to match your bike's scheme, the Ravager's design adds a touch of style to your setup.
review.name: Part 1

name: Ravager EXO/TR Tire

description: Buy the PNW Components The Loam Carbon Handlebar online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: The Loam Carbon Handlebar
hasVariant.description: Buy the PNW Components The Loam Carbon Handlebar online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I have been experiencing minor discomfort on the outside of my hand after riding an hour or so. Despite adjusting my current carbon bar I couldn’t resolve the issue. I finally concluded if I had a little more backsweep the edge of the bar would fit my hand better. Current bar has 8 degrees backsweep. PNW Loam has 10 degrees. That was the ticket. Immediately the Loam bar felt comfortable and continues to do so after hours of riding. It dampens vibrations and responds 100% to rider input. It is not flexy at all. Way to go PNW!
review.name: The backsweep sold me on this bar

review.reviewBody: The Loam handlebar has a great feel. I really like the extra degree of back sweep. They also do a great job of muting out some chatter.  I installed these bars and basically forgot they were there. They are super comfortable. I also appreciated the subdued graphics. You can go crazy with a sticker kit if you want
review.name: Disappear on the Bike.

review.reviewBody: I started with the range aluminum bar and liked the bend but wanted a little more rise. The 38 mil rise was perfect for me and the bar has better dampening than the range bar. Overall happy with my purchase.
review.name: Exceeded expectations

review.reviewBody: I replaced the stock bar on my Orbea Wild with this and find it to be more comfortable than the old bar. Not worried about weight savings on the eMTB, but is is noticeably lighter than the aluminum bar. It is the same width, so cockpit layout is perfect. I do like the additional sweep, too. Overall a great upgrade.
review.name: Great upgrade from my stock aluminum bar

name: The Loam Carbon Handlebar

review.reviewBody: Wonderful bag for short distance trip with durable matrial
review.name: Nice backpack

review.reviewBody: Zippered vest pocket could be slightly larger to more easily accommodate phones and this pack would benefit from a roll top and stretchy side pockets but with that being said it’s comfortable to run with and has minimal bounce when fully loaded.
review.name: Zippered vest pocket could be

review.reviewBody: I love how comfortable this bag is. It looks good, it's compact, and the weight distribution makes it very comfortable to carry lightweight gear on fast trecks
review.name: Great bag

review.reviewBody: Great capacity for a single light fastpack overnight or ultra long alpine run. Great features, low movement and stoked for ice axe carry and helmet carry. Need it for fastpack early season in the Juans
review.name: Stoke is high

review.reviewBody:
I've only used it for one weekend in the Valley so far, but covered 27 pitches so can say with some basis this pack was great for moving fast and holding everything we needed. It easily held 4L of water, gear, layers, and snacks. And even when it was fully loaded I barely noticed it. 

One complaint is there isn't a built in internal pocket to secure keys or similar. But there are places you could attach something to that affect yourself.
review.name: Great pack for big climbing days

review.reviewBody: I was looking for durable pack that didn’t sit on my hips and hugged close. So many convenient pockets and just an overall great bag. Highly recommend!
review.name: Killer hybrid pack

review.reviewBody:
Great design overall but there needs to be a waist strap. I’ve had to make my own otherwise it keeps moving and will cause chafe on long runs. Not sure how they didn’t think of this when designing. I wouldn’t have paid full price but considering it’s half off then I think it’s a good price for a product that needs extra work. 
Otherwise 10/10!
review.name: Good but bouncy

review.reviewBody: I love the pac and was able pare down my gear enough for a 4 day summer backpacking trip with food etc. through the Sierras (beyond ultralight). My one gripe is that I bought it for fast packing (I know it's not designed for this application) but it bounces far too much when running with a load. I had intended to fast pack that trip, but could only hike because the bouncing made running impossible for me. I like the capacity, closure, comfort I'm 5'9" and 160 and I believe I bought the Medium. This will become my daypack for fishing. The hiking pole sleeves are great for carrying Tenkara rods... I'm still in the market for a 20-30 liter fast packing/running pack.
review.name: Love it, but it's not for running

review.reviewBody: Have used it on 2 longer runs so far, fits everything I need (including my full complement of emergency gear), puffy, jacket, food and water. Great attachment points, fits nicely and didn't have any problems with it moving around too much during running even when fully weighted.
review.name: Perfect large running pack

review.reviewBody: Took it on a three day trip through the Beauforts on Vancouver Island. Stuffed it. Worked really well.
review.name: So good

name: Distance 22L Backpack

review.reviewBody: Very comfortable and fits perfectly for me.  always love Fizik since it fits me perfectly.
review.name: Very Confortable Aero Saddle

review.reviewBody: This is the best saddle I've ever used. It just disappears. Comfortable for all hip angles. No numbness.
review.name: So comfortable I don't even notice it

review.reviewBody: To summarize my use with this saddle, I have done rides lasting anywhere from two to seven hours with it. I've used this saddle for the past year, riding thousands of miles with it, and I am happy to say that it has served me very well in that time. This saddle perfectly balances weight with comfort (for a saddle meant for racing, that is). I haven't had any outstanding issues with this during my use, so I absolutely recommend this saddle for those of you who need a more comfortable power saddle. If you're sensitive to a hard saddle, or if you do not own a chamois, this probably isn't the saddle for you...
review.name: So far, so good

review.reviewBody:
I've really struggled to find a saddle that fits me properly.  I spent last season on a Pro Vibe Stealth, and liked it well enough, but once I transitioned to indoor riding, where there was less movement on long intervals, the lack of padding became a bit too spartan.  At first, I tried the Argo Tempo in search of a bit more padding, but I found it too soft.  I would sink into it and get hot spots and numbness.  I've found this to be a good in between between those two. Still not perfect, but as close as I've found, after using it on all day rides, indoor training sessions, etc.

I did have to get my original saddle warrantied after the softer rubber wings separated at the edge of the saddle where they connect to the stiff carbon edge.  Fizik was super easy to deal with and they just sent me a new saddle.
review.name: Not too hard, not too soft, just right.

name: Argo Vento R1 Saddle

review.reviewBody: Pearl Izumi men’s tops actually fit me! I’m only 5 foot 8 inches, quite muscular, big in shoulders, big arms. My entire cycling life has meant sending tops back because I can’t get them on. I buy these in xxl and they fit well. I recommend this brand for non-skinny people.
review.name: Great quality

review.reviewBody: I should have known better. PI's quality has fallen off a cliff. Lovely feeling piece, arm stitching became unraveled on 2nd ride.
review.name: Pearl Izumi quality woes

review.reviewBody:
The fabric on this jersey is very nice, unlike the 100% recycled polyester of the mid-tier jerseys.

But the cut is bizarre - the neck hole is gigantic. Almost like a v-neck or something. I specifically wanted a UPF50 jersey so I don't have to coat myself in sunscreen.. but instead there's this huge hole where your head comes out.

I've been a lifetime Pearl Izumi buyer due to their awesome warranty, but they no longer appear to sell anything I can ride.
review.name: bizarrely huge neck hole

review.reviewBody: Love this jersey.  The extra zip up pocket is nice.  The jersey is aero does fit tight, so one should probably go one size up from normal.
review.name: Gophil

name: Attack Air Jersey - Men's

review.reviewBody: I have found that some mesh jerseys are course. That’s not the case here. It uses a very fine soft mesh that is comfortable.  Why do some summer jerseys have collars? On a hot ride you I don’t want my neck insulated. I appreciated no collar on this jersey.  If you want a loose summer jersey, then don’t select this one. It’s meant to go close to your skin and absorb sweat.  Amazingly as I rode along on a hot day, I could actually feel the cooling effect of the material.. As for fit, it’s classic Castelli. This means if you’re between sizes always pick the larger size.  I bought this as something new to try and after using it, I’m keeping it and would recommend it.
review.name: Good Jersey for hot Summer days

name: Superleggera 3 Jersey - Men's

description: Buy the Black Diamond IAD Double Gear Sling online or shop all Climb from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: IAD Double Gear Sling
hasVariant.description: Buy the Black Diamond IAD Double Gear Sling online or shop all Climb from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Used this on the Nose of El Cap. Didn't do it in a day because I'm not at that level of awesome, but I did complete the route and hardly felt this piece of gear on my body. Intuitive placement of gear loops made it so I always felt like I had space to rack things, and it was low profile enough that I could handle the offwidths fine without needing to remove it (I just racked my gear on one side). My favorite part is the fact that it moves with my body, and the fabric does not restrict my movement like other chest harnesses do. I got a lot of curious questions about it from other parties so I figured I'd write a review. I'm a 5'11 female weighing 150lbs and the S/M fit great. (And for the ladies wondering, I'm a C cup and there was still plenty of room for adjustment in the chest area if I was bigger or smaller. I landed in the middle of the sternum strap adjustment range).
review.name: It's great

name: IAD Double Gear Sling

review.reviewBody: Have 2 older pairs, and like them so much I ordered a 3rd. I noticed they change from a snap closure to a button.
review.name: Great, comfortable shorts

review.reviewBody: These are the best shorts I own and worth the price. Very comfortable and I’ve now gotten a pair in each color (10” in Carbon color, 8” in the other two). The fabric of the Silencer is fairly light and breathable, with some stretch. It also seems durable as I’ve had these a couple years, wearing them regularly, and they show no noticeable signs of wear. I especially like the 8” length for packing on trips because they’re versatile enough to look a little dressy. They work equally well whether worn casually with a t-shirt out on a hike or paired with a polo to go golfing or out to dinner. I’ve frequently gotten comments from people on how nice they look. (I also have a pair of the Radikl shorts, which are uber comfortable for hiking, etc. but the fabric and cut have a much more casual look.) The Silencer has the standard Kuhl drop in pocket, which works great for a phone or glasses. Try these — you won’t regret it.
review.name: My Favorite Shorts

name: Silencr Kargo 8in Short - Men's

hasVariant.name: Give-N-Go 2.0 Bikini Brief - Women's
hasVariant.description: Buy the ExOfficio Give-N-Go 2.0 Bikini Brief - Women's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: These are perfect for any occasion, from 70F+ degree weather to 30F degrees. I love how secure they feel around my waist without being too snug. They are also made to last: my last pair of Ex-Officio briefs outlasted my Patagonia pair easily by a year or more. Will continue purchasing only Ex-Officio. Please don't change!
review.name: Amazing Fit and Feel

review.reviewBody: Love how durable and quick drying these underwear are. They are very comfy and my favorite moisture wicking underwear. These are my everyday underwear. Thank you for making extended sizes and hope you extend sizes more for more body diversity!
review.name: Fav moisture wicking underwear

review.reviewBody: Great quick dry travel underwear.  Made for more athletic build, so size up.
review.name: Travel undies

review.reviewBody: These are true to size, and comfy. They are breathable, and quick-dry from being active or handwashing for travel. Unfortunately, they are also very poorly made. One of the pairs I purchased had a hole between the elastic waistband and fabric straight out of the package from missing or broken stitching. ExOfficio quality has apparently plummeted, since this brand used to be known for durability. I will not be purchasing ExOfficio again; many other quick-dry/active/travel underwear are available these days for much lower price points.
review.name: Good fit/comfort, poor quality
comment:
Hello there

Thank you for providing us with a feedback on our products. We truly appreciate you bringing the matter to our attention. I am very sorry to hear that the item has not met your expectations. We will make sure to forward your idea and feedback to an appropriate department, so that we may think about an appropriate solution for the future. Thank you so much for sharing your opinion with us.

If you have any more questions, please reach out to us via https://www.exofficio.com/support/contact-us or through LiveChat. We’re available Mon-Fri, 9AM - 5PM EST

Thank you,
ExOfficio Consumer Care

review.reviewBody: I tried these for the first time and couldn’t be happier.   Fit was great and comfortable.   Easily dries overnight.  Ended up with 5 pairs because I wasn’t sure my original online order would show up in time so ended up buying a couple at local store but really could have gotten by with 2 on my four-week trip.
review.name: These are the bomb!

review.reviewBody: I find these great anytime, but for travel they are perfect.  They wash and dry quickly so no need to spend precious vacation time in a laundromat!
review.name: Skip the Laundromat

review.reviewBody: Great fit and great performance! I use these to travel anywhere. I wear a pair and bring a pair. Wash them out in the evening and they're dry by morning. Easy peasy.
review.name: Use these to travel anywhere

review.reviewBody: I bought my third one of these bras a few months ago and unfortunately the quality of this product has seriously declined. When I bought my first one I loved it so much, wore it almost every day and it lasted years. The second one lasted a few years before the elastic eventually wore out. My third one has already almost completely fallen apart after just a couple months. The design is different than it used to be and is less flattering. The new fabric is thin and flimsy and does almost nothing to hold up the girls. So disappointing, it seems like every company now is cutting corners and just letting the quality of their products go downhill.
review.name: Decline in quality

review.reviewBody:
I recently received a Nemo duffle 55L bag as a gift.  
It is one of the best gifts ever. It is very well made with high quality materials. It opens easy and wide as a duffle to hold everything I need. The duffle straps are long enough to carry it on my shoulder. I use it for travel and then to carrying all my gear for the weekend.  I use it for grocery shopping. I fill it with lots of kids stuff to go to and from the mountains to ski or take a day hike. It has become my preferred weekend travel bag. The size I have (55L) is an official carry on. The backpack straps make it easy to carry all my stuff through the airport. The carrying bag can be used as a tote for all small items like chargers, headphones and keys. The pockets on the outside come in handy for those last minute things you need to put in a pocket like sunglasses. This bag has so many uses. I don’t know how I lived without it. I use it for everything. I am now buying it as a gift for others and encourage you to do the same. It is must have gear for anyone.
review.name: Great Features, Great Travel Bag

review.reviewBody:
Permanent new home of my AT ski boots, helmet and goggles, socks - base - down - shell gear, expansion room to spare.

Overbuilt and beautifully finished and reinforced inside & out, unlike a lot of others.
review.name: Best duffle ever!

review.reviewBody:
One of the best design with too many features. I am using it from past 6 months for car camping and going to taekwondo classes with my kids. Perfect usage. It's durable, stylish enough and light weight. 
I tried to use it in the back country camping and air travel. It is complicated for this purpose. The design of the zipper or the main closing/open area is not helpful to hold bulky weight. I struggled to pack and close the zipper with bulkier items.  Hope they can make the mouth wider after zipped up.
review.name: Great bag, durable material and too many features.

review.reviewBody:
I run outdoor programs where I bring my personal gear and program gear for participants. I needed a duffel large enough to hold all of my personal stuff and this does that wonderfully. I can fit my 2p tent, smaller sleeping pad, and down sleeping bag into this along with my clothes, toiletries, and small gear and it is easy to carry. When I want to indulge and bring my self-inflating car camping pad, I can snap the handles around it so that they are a unit. The inside zipper pocket is a little low to access when the bag is full, but it is large enough to hold lots of little things. The two top pockets that snap are fine for items with a little bulk -I find that stacks of stickers, cards, or even small notebooks tend to pop out of them regardless of how full the bag is. I think adding a zipper closure to one of them would make this bag even better, but I still like using it.

I also have the 30L bag and have used that for short trips (in hotels) and big days out with the family.
review.name: Exactly what I needed

review.reviewBody:
I own a 30 L and 55 L double haul bags, the 55 is pictured. 
I also own and am comparing them to an original North Face base camp large 95 L, an even bigger original Patagonia black hole bag and newer basecamp medium 62 L. 
Where the double haul really shines is the stand up wide opening for loading, the convenience of a tote and it's versatility converting to a duffel/ backpack for use as a carry-on or long hauls. 
I really like that tote mode doubles the capacity. Being able to leave the zipper open, overstuff the bag with mountain bike or backcountry skiing gear, throw the straps over a shoulder and go. Zipper it up if you're feeling the fear of loosing your stuff. The tote straps fold neatly away into a hidden snapped compartment when not in use.
If l'm traveling on a plane, what works best for me is to open the ends up to tote mode and load everything then fold the dopp kit style ends into duffle mode.
I like the ridgid handles. They stay put and are easy to grab on the go no fiddling around required.  They also allow the bag to be carried close to your hand rather than sagging on loose straps towards the ground. The padded backpack straps carry the bag comfortably. Although the ridgid handles that now rest against your back are definitely noticable but not a deal breaker. When not in use the backpack straps retract close to the bag, the adjuster webbing tails are easy to rethread back into their retracted position and snap out of the way.
In duffle bag mode, ends folded and clipped down, you do have much more limited access through the zipper opening. 
I like the heavy duty zippers and big pulls. 
The outside storage pocket is nice, but I find that the inside pocket gets buried. Good for stuff you don't need easy access to but don't want the items disappearing into the void.
The material feels robust, good for rough handling, long time service and the occasional drag across an airport. The materials are pliable and supported nicely by 6 vertical stay, one in each corner and one at either end. 
I like double hauls in the 2 smaller sizes l own. I would be concerned to go bigger. What l really like about the base camp and black hole bags are big grab handles on either end of the bags allowing you to grab and pull it out of a vehicle or carry the heavy loads sideways two handed. You can do this on the double haul by grabbing the end buckles and straps but it's not as comfortable.
Overall these bags check a lot of boxes, are extremely utilitarian and we expect them to accompany us on many adventures for years to come.
review.name: Great carry-on sized gear hauler

review.reviewBody: We recently took the dive and ordered the double haul 30L in a Hail Mary to de-complicate my family’s chaotic work+kids+sports+food/sleep way of life. We were so impressed by the versatility and sheer VOLUME of stuff we could move comfortably and quickly. Because of that we ordered the 55L!!! This bag is now our official away tournament bag. It makes a perfect carry-all and straps down neatly enough for grown ups to take on work trips too. Thank you for putting so much thought into the little details!
review.name: Perfect for work and play

review.reviewBody:
The bag has three types of carrying straps:
1. Comfortable, supportive, cushioning back pack straps with adjustable length
2. Kind of uncomfortable, sturdy straps to go over your shoulder
3. Rigid supportive hand grips (black) to lift at your side

The main problem is that 2 is a useless strap. For carrying any amount of weight it's more comfortable and efficient to just use the better backpack strap as a shoulder strap. 

Nemo can improve this bag by:
1. Removing the kind of useless tote style strap
2. Adjusting the backpack strap cushion length to make it better function as the tote style strap
3. Adding zippers to the pockets that hold the tote style strap and simply making them additional pockets instead of weird holders for the unnecessary straps.

Those are my thoughts at least. Still enjoying the bag as an airplane carry on.
review.name: Fantastic Bag, A Bit Pricey, One Design Miss

review.reviewBody: I bought this to haul gear for van camping weekends. I primarily pack clothing, a hygiene kit, and some books in the duffle. The 55-liter holds a lot, I use one bag for both myself and my 3-year-old stuff for a weekend outing. The material feels durable, I believe this will last for years to come, and so far been using it all summer. It's 4-stars for me as I find the interior space difficult to keep organized compared to a typical duffle bag style. I get this bag is designed differently to have multiple purposes, both duffle and tote style. However for me, when the sides of the bag are clipped down to be in "duffle mode", I lose small objects in the side area where the bag clips down. (tried to show that in the photo with the glove.) It leaves a little corner for stuff to disappear in. To remedy this, I use packing cubes to organize my clothes, headlamps, etc. Having loose clothing and small items in the bag doesn't work for me and my personal organization needs. That being said, it's a quality bag and the blue color is beautiful. I imagine we'll use it for years to come on many van camping adventures.
review.name: Great Family Gear Hauler

review.reviewBody: I recently purchased the 55L duffle and am so impressed with the quality of the materials. The convertibility of this bag was key for me, as it can be used for so many things, work, travel, gym. The internal organization of pockets and dividers is excellent! Looking forward to using this bag a lot!
review.name: Superbly built

review.reviewBody: Needed a durable and versatile duffel bag, and this one has everything I could want. Love the material and the different carrying options
review.name: Fantastic Bag

name: Double Haul Convertible Duffel 55L Bag

review.reviewBody: As a gloveless rider I really love the rubber compound and the mold is spot on.
review.name: Fantastic grips

review.reviewBody:
I've been using these grips for about a year and I'm already on my 2nd pair! (I should add I ride minimum 3x a week and I also crash semi-frequently. So they don't wear out super fast, I just use them a lot!) I can also comment that they hold up pretty well in a crash. They are super grippy but still give a good bar feel, and I feel like they reduce my hand fatigue. The single lock-on is nice and simple, but there's a plastic lining inside the grips to make them a little stiffer like a dual-sided lock-on. I wear a size L glove if I'm buying women's gloves or a size M if I'm buying men's, so I have a pretty average-sized hand (some of my smaller handed friends say these are a little too big for them, but I don't have personal experience with that).
Pair these with the OneUp Bars for a fire combo that has enough flex to reduce hand fatigue, but still has a grippy and confident feel.
review.name: Only Grips I'll Use!

review.reviewBody: I got these for more comfort on longer rides.  I've used them on two rides now first was only 5 miles of gnar and I already noticed they gave me hand fatigue I didn't have before but the grip is amazing. The next ride was 12 miles and my hands were super uncomfortable. Normally up to 16 miles without any hand discomfort. So I think they would work for someone else but just not for small hands.
review.name: Not what I hoped for

name: Grips

review.reviewBody: I have many TNF hoodies that I love, and I've historically always been able to count on them fitting the same. But recently I purchased three hoodies, two of the same design in different colors plus this one, but all in what were supposed to be the same size and cut. Sadly they are very different both in fit (length and width) and hand feel, even though they have the same material makeup. Only one really fits (not this one) and I will likely be returning two. I've noticed the same issue with the long sleeve T shirts. It's too bad because I really love TNF, and otherwise the quality is good, but for me, this one is too short & fits smaller than usual.
review.name: Inconsistent sizing.

review.reviewBody: Camping in canvas is amazing- It breaths so much more than a nylon tent, so no more waking up sweating when the sun starts to hit the tent in the AM. Springbar has also created a design that is SO easy to put up, I'm a petite 5'3" and can easily carry and put up this tent by myself. Once you get the stakes in it literally takes maybe 5 mins. The Classic Jack is a great year round tent and does amazing in the sun, rain, and wind. It feels like you're sleeping in a cabin, so roomy and comfortable. The materials are awesome- super quality and durable which is great since I don't have to worry about my two high energy dogs doing any damage even if they decide to start wrestling. I highly recommend!
review.name: Quick and Easy Canvas

name: Classic Jack 100

description: Buy the Gregory Juno H20 30L Daypack - Women's online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Juno H20 30L Daypack - Women's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Gregory Juno H20 30L Daypack - Women's online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Got this pack for day hiking trips. A actually used it as a carry on for flights and it worked great. Spacious for day hiking adventures. Not a lot of pockets but for a day pack I was more concerned with weight and room for essentials (down jacket, rain coat) and a few other items including water and snacks. It fits that bill perfectly.
review.name: Great day pack

review.reviewBody: I used this bag on a 10-day hiking trip in Europe, covering about 18-24 km (12-15 miles) each day. The Gregory Juno 30 H2O was incredibly comfortable to carry, even with my pack weighing around 18 lbs. It held everything I needed for the entire trip, although I didn't carry any camping gear since I stayed in places that provided all the essentials. Overall, it was the perfect companion for long days on the trail
review.name: Great bag to travel with and hike with

review.reviewBody:
When I decided to invest in a good quality hiking backpack, I started researching different brands to make sure I find the perfect bag for me and my husband. I can't begin to tell you how amazing the Juno and Citro bags are!!!!!! 
First, I absolutely love the universal measurements for men and women, you dont need to worry about this at all! the fit was perfect for both me and my husband. the straps are adjustable at the hip, shoulder and back making it perfect for everyone.
I decided to go with the 30L because I needed a bag I can use for any sort of hiking no matter the length or difficulty of the hike
The size was perfect, I can put all my essentials and still have room if I ever decided on taking extra things, like a towel, water shoes or even extra clothes 
the weight difference between the 30L and smaller size was not that significant to me.
They really thought about every detail on this bag!!! you have a place to set your sunglasses, and your poles which was amazing!!! i didnt feel the weigh of the poles on me at all
the bag comes with a water bladder which was a plus!! the bladder was amazing, we had no issues with it at all, no leaking and easy to clean.
We hiked at Mt Rainier and it held great, there were some rainy days and the bag held it self well, it's not water proof (they dont claim it is) so I do recommend getting a raincover but the insides werent soaking with water.
I love this bag so much and I do recommend it to anyone! amazing bag!
review.name: AMAZING BAG! LOVE LOVE LOVE!

review.reviewBody: This pack has done everything I've needed it for.  It's very comfortable and has plenty of space for a day or two.  The straps are easily adjustable and the pocket layout is well thought-out.  I cant wait to get back out there and put it to more use.
review.name: Nice pack

review.reviewBody: Extremely comfortable due to the various ways that it can be adjusted. It has room to spare for everything that I need for an 8 day walking tour on which I will carry all my clothing etc. rather than paying for transport from accommodation to accommodation.
review.name: comfortable and spacious

review.reviewBody: This is the perfect size for a long day hike. I loved having the hydration system readily available while hiking. I'm more likely to stay properly hydrated when I don't have to stop and take out my water bottle. Lots of great pockets, pouches and storage. Also very comfortable and adjustable. I got the mineral yellow color and it's super cute, too!
review.name: Perfect Day Pack

review.reviewBody: This is almost the perfect day pack. I had a different brand but it was lacking in so many ways. Gregory has thought of almost everything. Only thing I’d like to see is a bigger outside zip pocket for snacks! I love the hanging clip for the hydration bladder, and that the hose detaches up top instead of way down by the outlet. Hip belt pockets fit my phone and all the little stuff. All the straps were perfectly comfortable even with a tank top on, no rubbing on a 10 mile hike.
review.name: 99% perfect!

review.reviewBody: Looked forever for a pack that I could take on day hikes but also use as a daily gym bag as well as a personal item on a plane. Technically this pack is too long for a personal item, but so far I haven’t had any issues or been asked to check it. I needed a pack that had hydration storage for hikes. The bonus is that I can use that same storage for my laptop when I travel. Organization is also really important to me and this pack has sufficient pockets and spaces for that.
review.name: Great multipurpose pack

review.reviewBody: This is a great pack! I needed a new pack and after checking out several brands and models, I ultimately chose this one for an upcoming inn-to-inn hiking trip to Scotland. I used it for 8 days, 103 miles, and it was everything I had been looking for and needed. The integrated hydration system is fantastic, easy to care for and to fill on the fly. The fit is great, the shoulder straps and hip belt very comfortable.
review.name: Love this pack!

review.reviewBody: I absolutely love this pack. It’s a little bigger than what I actually need for a daypack, but this is so comfortable I use it for every hike. The back panel is a dream and keeps your back from sweating. I wish Gregory would incorporate this excellent back panel on all their packs. Love my Swift but the Juno rules for hot weather outings.
review.name: No back sweat!

name: Juno H20 30L Daypack - Women's

hasVariant.description: Buy the BioLite FirePit Grill Lid online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I bought the lid to better utilize the grill function on the BioLite FirePit Plus. The grill lid worked well and did what you'd expect a grill lid to do, hold in heat for more even cooking. I am not a fan of the FirePit though, it doesn't work anywhere near as well as a SoloStove does. The fires I had in it were anemic, had a lot more smoke than I was used to, and the grill surface (the reason I bought the FirePit +) was too small to be very functional. I also don't see the BioLite aging well, after just a couple uses it was showing its age and you have to be VERY careful of moisture with the BioLite. For the money I think SoloStove is a better all-around firepit, however, the SoloStove grill is going to set you back quite a bit of money so if an all-in-one sub $300 "smokeless" fire pit that can function as a make shift grill is what you are looking for the BioLite might be your only option.
review.name: Lid does it's job, not a fan FirePit

review.reviewBody: nice addition! got it on sale. fits the bill! it is what it is... can't get it elsewhere...
review.name: nice addition for grilling

review.reviewBody: I was one of the people who invested to get the fire pit started and this is something that I have been wanting on great job
review.name: The cover that your fire pit needs

review.reviewBody: This was a Christmas present and something told me to open it because it was retaped. I was shocked at the quality. It was a return that they didn't inspect why it was returned. I could only post 6 pictures, but I have several more spots of bad quality. This is not Biolite quality and if this is what they are making, I will stop buying Biolite (was just about to get solar panels, but I am going elsewhere).
review.name: Horrid Quality, Obvious Return, Warped, Chipped
comment: Hi there! We are so sorry to hear about this experience! We do not accept returns on opened and used merchandise. I am so sorry for the confusion. This issue most likely happened at the manufacturer. For this, we are so sorry. Please reach out to our support team at support@bioliteenergy.com. We would love to send you a replacement grill lid ASAP!

review.reviewBody: Fit perfectly. I wanted the lid to help snuff out the fire and make it safer when the fire is not completely out. Haven't tried out yet, but cooler Temps are coming. My fire pit will be my outdoor see through fireplace insert. Will burn half the wood compared to just using the open fireplace.
review.name: Fire pit grill lid

review.reviewBody: Now you have a real grill. Very easy to make use of your pit other than just a pretty fire. The tase with real wood is amazing and this lid gives you good control over the temps.
review.name: A whole new thing.

review.reviewBody: Fits well and packs nicely in the carrier that I had purchased previously. Looking forward to taking the whole setup to the beach!
review.name: Good fit for travel

review.reviewBody: I haven’t used it yet, but it seems to be well made and it fits the grill very good.
review.name: Fire pit grill lid

review.reviewBody: Great fit on the FirePit--even with optional cast iron griddle in place. Sturdy construction!
review.name: Great fit and sturdy

review.reviewBody:
I have been looking for a lid for my fire pit grill 
Happy I found this
review.name: Lid-stacular

name: FirePit Grill Lid

review.reviewBody: This is a great all around harness. Great for gym or crag. Gear loops provide more than enough space for trad gear & are built well. Harness is comfortable to hang in for relatively short periods of time (haven’t tested long time periods). Overall very happy with my purchase.
review.name: Love it!

review.reviewBody: It's very uncomfortable. The anchor points on the thighs and waist are just off and make getting lowered or taking falls extremely uncomfortable and at some angles painful.
review.name: I would not recommend

review.reviewBody: I bought this for a climbing trip and it worked great, but the orange loops are already tearing. Really disappointed with that considering I've just bought it.
review.name: Lots of loops, pretty to look at
Comfortable Harness

review.reviewBody:
Two things I like best about this harness:

1. Extreme durability: I've had the harness since May and have used it for rock climbing, snow climbing, alpine climbing, and via ferrata. It's been used in 3 countries so far. Despite all of the work I've given this harness so far, it still looks brand new. No snags or obvious marks on the exterior. No wear. No issues at seams. Considering all I've done with this harness, I'm pleasantly surprised with how well it's holding up.

2. Comfort: this harness fits me really well. I'm small but the adjustable leg straps are great with some additional musculature on my thigh. The wider leg straps also make belaying and climbing sport climbs very comfortable and secure. The waist strap is wide enough around my back to provide good support and the padding is just right. 

Overall, this is an excellent harness especially if you stay busy and plan to use it all the time.
review.name: Very comfortable harness

review.reviewBody: This is a bit expensive but it is very light and soft compared to other harnesses. The leg straps have a lot of room for it's size but if you fit a large for instance for your legs and have room on the waistband this is likely to do the same, your legs and waist have to be the same pant size for this to fit well (of course). This definitely works for indoor climbing and while I have yet to go out with it, the hard, reinforced gear loops don't get in the way and aren't uncomfortable at all.
review.name: Truly comfortable

review.reviewBody:
Le harnais est super bien construit, respire bien, bonne boucle pour le mat√©riel et il est confortable. 2 petits b√©mol:
Erreur de commande...mod√®le femme...les cuisse sont vraiment trop grande pour moi...mais c'est mon erreur üòâ
La superposition de la sangle de taille √† l'int√©rieur n'est pas tr√®s pratique.
review.name: Un autre super produit mammut

review.reviewBody: I really want to love this harness and give it top marks, and I do love everything except one huge thing that ruins it: the leg loops are way too big and have way too little adjustability. Note the Mammut: climbers have skinny legs! At the very least, you need a system that allows the leg loops to be adjustable with a good range. This harness allows just 6cm of adjustment. 6cm! Little more than 2 inches. That is really not good enough for a very expensive harness that is great in every other way.
review.name: Fantastic with one huge problem

hasVariant.description: Buy the Topeak Pocket Shock Digital Fork & Shock Pump online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.itemreviewed: Pocket Shock Digital Fork & Shock Pump
review.reviewBody:
Even though I am not a pro rider,the accurate psi is nice to have. Easy to pump. When disengage the valve, two valve system prevents loosing air pressure. Love this!
Honestly Topeak brand makes all products nice and stylish. Also durable!!
review.name: Easy,Efficientive,Accurate

review.itemreviewed: Pocket Shock Digital Fork & Shock Pump
review.reviewBody: I needed a digital pump to tune in a more accurate pressure on my shock and fork. This Topeak digital pump is accurate and just as easy to use as the dial versions. It does require a 2 step process to ensure no pressure is lost but it's worth it. Very little air is released when removing. I've compared this to my ShockWiz that I have attached to my shock. The pressure difference is around 0.1-0.2 psi. Way better than the pumps that don't have the 2 step process. The screen is easy to read as well. Overall, I'm very pleased with the pump and I recommend it.
review.name: My New Favorite Shock Pump

review.itemreviewed: Pocket Shock Digital Fork & Shock Pump
review.reviewBody: They should change pocket in the name to backpack, it is not small.  The disconnect for the air connector is a little misleading.  It could do with a better explanation. When you connect it you will loose 5-7psi ish from it filling the line.  When you disconnect it you will hear air hiss out.  I have a shockwiz connected that shows pressure.  When you disconnect, it does not loose air.  It's only the air in the tool escaping.  It only loses air when connecting.
review.name: Not Pocket size but works well

review.itemreviewed: Pocket Shock Digital Fork & Shock Pump
review.reviewBody:
I knew that I wanted to get a digital pump. Being a constant tinkerer with my suspension, starring and trying to get accurate readings out of my analog topeak pump was starting to become a chore. With the new crop of 38mm forks, even a few PSI can make a noticeable difference to ride feel and sag (especially the Zeb as it runs at low pressures), so getting pressures exactly where you want them helps simplify the rest of the setup. 

Enter the topeak pocket shock digital. Slightly longer than a DXG (the similar analog pump) I?ve found the new digital version very easy to use and read. It?s impossible to understate how convenient the digital display is. For me, it?s a night and day difference. Build quality is excellent, I love the dual stage valve (same as on the analog version) and seems like it has more psi per stroke vs. the analog version (less pumping). Air release valves are simple to use and on the digital version are much easier to avoid accidentally hitting as you?re pumping. The pump has a very handy off/on feature to help conserve battery as well.

Is it necessary? No. Especially if you already have a quality analog pump. But, If you have multiple bikes (or even one) that you find yourself consistently adjusting pressures and tinkering with, I think the digital pocket shock pump is an excellent addition to your kit. As usual, backcountry.com and competitive cyclist are great.

Pros: build quality, ease of use, simply having a digital display. Looks great. Auto on/off feature

Cons: expensive vs most analog pumps. 300 psi max may not be enough if you run high pressures in a high max psi shock (fox dps/dpx2 for example)
review.name: Topeak Digital Pump

name: Pocket Shock Digital Fork & Shock Pump

review.reviewBody: I'm a 8.5 in the Escalante racers and got these in the same size however def run a half size too small. My toes hit the front but I decided to keep them. I've put 350+ miles on these shoes and their cushion and support are finally feeling flat now. I got plantar fasciitis almost a year ago because I went from 100% trail to 100% road. In two weeks with the racers I got PF in my right heel. These shoes allowed me to keep running, increase my mileage from 20, to 30's for weeks on end and peaked at 40 mpw. (I'm a newer runner). Truly an amazing shoe in terms of extreme comfort to help you stack up miles if dealing with an injury such as PF or any other foot tendonitis from impact. I truly don't have any complaints outside of my toes hitting the front, so I'd recommend a half size bigger. I would certainly buy these again. Altra, can we restock the 9's in white please?
review.name: 350+ miles later... workhorse mileage builder

review.reviewBody: I wear these shoes for every day use, walking and comfort. I have bilateral knee replacements, so I need good shoes on my feet. I buy men's shoes 3/4 of the time due to fit and the vibrant colors versus women's colors. I have bought probably 12 different pairs of this shoe over the past few years. Love them!
review.name: ♥️ I would buy this shoe over and over!

review.reviewBody: I wore these shoes for about 3 months and they are already falling apart on the inside. I work all day on my feet and I am concerned that theses shoes will not hold up much longer. NOT WORTH THE MONEY
review.name: Inside of shoe started to rip apart after 3 months

review.reviewBody: Due to metatarsalgia I purchased these shoes for the wide toe box and zero drop. After sizing up to 12 from my normal 11.5, the shoes are very comfortable and roomy. I only use them in the house. After about two months, the shoes began to squeak pretty loud. I also purchased one of the newer 4 mm drop trail shoes and have yet to squeak, however, I'm hesitant to purchase any more Altras due to this engineering flaw.
review.name: Comfortable But Squeak Badly

review.reviewBody: Whenever Altra makes a change, it's hit or miss. I bought a pair of the original Via Olympus shoes in 2023, and went from barely running a mile to training for my first marathon. Early in 2024, I figured I should get another pair so I'd have newer shoes going into the marathon. This is when Altra switched and came out with the Via Olympus 2. Right off the bat I noticed something was off. The left shoe seemed to cause my ankle to pronate, but not the right. I went ahead and tried to use them for a few weeks, and it completely trashed my marathon training. Thankfully I still have a few hundred miles of life left in my first pair until Altra figures out how they screwed these shoes up so bad. Thankfully I bought these through REI and I can return them.
review.name: Another failed model upgrade

review.reviewBody: I wanted to love this shoe as I have been wearing altras since 2011,but the extra room needed in the midfoot became an issue.I feel pressure under the medial and lateral sides of the midfoot that became too painful as time went on.Cushion still good,heel good,toe box great.If you have normal shaped feet,Altra is a great shoe.However over the years my midfoot has flattened out and Altra doesnt have a midfoot design in any of thier shoes for wide a wide midfoot.The Torin wide is the only model I can tolerate for a few hours even though my midfoot hangs over the last.ALTRA please make a line of shoes thin and thick cushion for truly flat feet.I had to go to different brands of shoes to find midfoot room,and they're not zero drop
review.name: 9 month update

review.reviewBody: The Via Olympus 2 is an outstanding shoe that delivers exceptional comfort, making it my top choice for long walks, runs or even just being on your feet all day. The cushioning provides excellent support, which is particularly beneficial for those like me dealing with plantar fasciitis. I've received a lot of compliments on the shoe's design, and it's a go-to in my shoe collection. The fit is also great, offering ample room in the toe box while still feeling secure. Overall, it's a fantastic blend of style, comfort and functionality. Nice work Altra.
review.name: Outstanding shoe

review.reviewBody: The heels wore out after two months of casual walking. Now the plastic is exposed and hurts my heel when I walk. The shoes are great but not durable at all. Two months is not acceptable life of a shoe. Very cheap fabric inside.
review.name: Heels wear out to fast

review.reviewBody: I love these shoes. Its my second pair. The first pair re still going strong, but I wanted a different color, so I bought a second pair. I've recommended to several of my friends and family who have feet issues.
review.name: My second pair!

review.reviewBody: I gave 3 stars because Altra does not stock enough size 14s. I love these shoes. They have a great fit, great toe box, and great comfort. The sole, however, does wear out pretty quickly. I am ready to buy another pair however, Altra has been out of size 14s. Please stock up on size 14s in all your original fit shoes because they are always sold out!
review.name: Need Size 14s!!

name: Via Olympus 2 Running Shoe - Men's

review.itemreviewed: Tempo Overcurve R4 Wide Cycling Shoe
review.reviewBody: I normally wear men size 9 but can also wear 8.5 wide.  My foot measures 10.125 inch by 4.125 so I am leaning on wide side.  I got the 42 wide and and it was spot on length wise and width was snug but acceptable.  Over a few rides I think the shoe will soften up and fit better in the width direction.  Rode 50 miles in the shoe today.  I notice a bump up in performance over my Shimano RC7 (2017).  Some of that I think is because the RC7 is a half size bigger than I need (43.5) driven more by the width so its less snug on the foot.  Also the Overcurve lets me move the cleat a little further back.  The single Boa works better than what I expected.  It is very smooth and pulls the shoe together with even pressure from top to bottom.
review.name: Right Fit and Performance Overcurve Wide

review.itemreviewed: Tempo Overcurve R4 Wide Cycling Shoe
review.reviewBody:
This is the most comfortable shoes I have ever had so far. I have wide feet and were using regular size shoes before. It was always really tied and not comfortable, some times causing my feet to sleep. Then I decided to test this wide shoes, and it is a completely game change for me. Finally I have a comfortable shoes that allows my feet to breath and helps me to transfer power without sufferings.
Best shoes I tested so far.
If you have wide feet, go with it. If you have regular feet, they have a regular size version for this as well. No brain.
I usually wear 10 US size for regular/ running shoes. I decided to go with a slight smaller size for this one and got the 9.75 US (43), and it was perfect.
review.name: The most comfortable shoes I had so far

name: Tempo Overcurve R4 Wide Cycling Shoe
