review.reviewBody: The best shorts ever.
review.name: Miles and miles ridden

review.itemreviewed: Bodyfit Pro LTD Bib Short - Men's
review.reviewBody:
I bought both a pair of these and the Fiandre NoRian Pro bibs last summer. For a tall lean bike rider (6'3") having shorts that fit well is challenging. Often they're too short in both inseam and straps, that's if the short portion itself is even suitable. These tick all the boxes for me. They inseams measure at over 11" in the size large. Straps are wide and long enough. Fit is compressive, body paint style, not for the faint of heart. The pad is outstanding, and goes way up high in front so no chafing. To me it's plenty thick as I'm used to much thinner pads.

I always wear a size large in everything so while I'd call these a normal fit, I checked "runs small" as I could see where someone heavier may find them a bit small. When new even I had to wiggle into them they were so snug around the hips, so take your time and don't force them on. I put them on as far I could then stopped and tried again the next day, repeat as needed ! They loosen up a little after a few uses. 

All this, and I neither race nor ride a racing bike anymore. I ride for the pure joy of simply riding, like surfing on land .... yeah !  I ride quality bib shorts though because once you ride in quality clothing you can never go back. These are quality, look at the design, the stitching.... it all speaks to quality.
review.name: Awesome Bibs for Tall and Lean

name: Bodyfit Pro LTD Bib Short - Men's

review.reviewBody:
Wanted to love this pack due to the rigid chassis and other design features.  Sadly, it misses the mark. 

Pros: 
-low profile, rigid chassis that fits snug on the body
-great look and the color is nice

Cons:
-Internal securing mechanism for the back bladder broke less than 15 minutes into my first run, poor material selection here
-the securing mechanism for the chest bottles is sewn into the wrong side of the pocket. So instead of the bottles being secured to the vest (closest to your chest) they are secured to the material on the far side of the pocket, creating a TON of bounce and not allowing the bottles to stay in the vest. 
-None of the pockets are secure with any kind of closure. Even as a light weight pack, the pockets can't be wide open. Not only do you not have the ability to secure valuables, but all the items you carry will make their way out onto the trail as litter.
review.name: Sadly misses the mark - and broke after one run!

name: Aenergy TR 5L Pack - Men's

review.reviewBody: Lovely and light, very comfortable and fabulous fit. The pockets also have great depth to them. The coat seems lovely and cosy too. The test will be next week in the Lake District!
review.name: Lovely and light, very comfortable

review.reviewBody: Loved the first one, so decided another colour would be good to ring the changes.

review.reviewBody: This is such a great lightweight but warm jacket. It is more of a slim fit, so it will be great under a shell. The red is a really beautiful color as well.
review.name: Love this jacket

review.reviewBody: I am happy with this jacket. I ordered a L in this Rab jacket and a L in a similar Black Diamond jacket and I'll keep both. I would note that the sizing is very different between the two. I am 5'8" with an hourglass shape so I like jackets that zip comfortably from my hips to my chest and have long enough sleeves. I also live in a cold climate so as the seasons go on I will layer under or over a puffer when going outside. The Rab jacket is slim fitting and I probably couldn't get away with much more than a light shirt underneath, but it's more flattering than the Black Diamond one. I also think that since it's slim I could wear a shell over it. The sleeves are barely just long enough and the zipper zips and doesn't bunch up. The Black Diamond jacket in L is generous all over including the sleeves. The Rab jacket comes with a stuff sack, Black Diamond does not. The Black Diamond one will be better if I'm wearing a thick sweater or just want a loose fit, but I wouldn't be able to wear a shell over the black Diamond jacket.
review.name: Nice all-around jacket

review.reviewBody: Grapefruit colour has a blackness in the fabric which makes the Rab look dirty so I returned it. I do have 3 others exactly same shape different colours & love them. It was also 2 sizes down from my normal size.
review.name: Grapefruit colour has a blackness

description: Buy the NEMO Equipment Inc. Moonlite Elite Reclining Camp Chair (Citron) online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Moonlite Elite Reclining Camp Chair (Citron)
hasVariant.description: Buy the NEMO Equipment Inc. Moonlite Elite Reclining Camp Chair (Citron) online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Just got the chair, took a little to figure out setup and then it 'clicked'.  Comfy to sit in and is easy to adjust.  Can't wait to load this up on the bike and go camping.
review.name: Out the box, good so far

review.reviewBody: I never thought I'd be so surprised and impressed by a camp chair. Over the last many years camp chair designs have funneled into a few archetypes and this chair first seemed like just another ultra-light chair among many. But every time I used it I liked it more. The matt/stowaway bag is what really sets it apart for me. The matt holds the chair legs and keeps them from splaying, making for a more durable/stronger chair (a common weakness among ultra-light chairs). It also prevents the chair legs from sinking into sand or loose soil (perfect for a 7-day beach backpacking trip I took this summer). I love being able to recline the chair with the suspension system. Chair goes up, chair goes down, all night around the campfire. Overall, I think this chair is unilaterally superior to all other ultra-light chairs and most regular and car camping chairs.
review.name: Delightful and Innovative

review.reviewBody:
Out of the box, stupid easy set up. Pretty freaking light and surprisingly comfortable for my 6’1” 210lb butt. 
I bought this chair to replace my glassing pad and get off the freezing ground during the late season hunts. It showed up after the season ended but my thoughts are:
-assembly and disassembly is quite loud. Not ideal for glassing sessions in the back country, but maybe practice makes perfect. 
-$50 more and 100g heavier then another competitors lite chair, which I accept as the carrier acts as a solid footprint and likely the cause for the added weight. 
I will definitely follow up with a review after a season of use if I can make it quiet!
review.name: First thoughts

review.reviewBody:
It’s light, easy to take anywhere. Though i wouldn’t take it backpacking cause, i can’t spare the extra pound.  It does not really need the extra wrap or the wraps double use as holding the legs secure.

Take it to every pickleball court i go to and sit comfortably throughout the day.

By the way, this is comfortable! Really comfortable and not hard to get in or out of.

Love it. Now just make it 8 oz. And i will take it backpacking!
review.name: This chair is near perfect

review.reviewBody: I have only used this chair a few times so far. You might say with a title like that, why only 4 stars. I just don't find it as comfortable as the old model I had tried out from a friend. That said, there are a lot of pros to this chair that I love. You can't beat the weight (it is great), it can be used on any surface using the mesh base, gets you off the ground, and IT ADJUSTS!! That to me was the deciding feature to get this chair. Most backpacking chairs are fixed in a leaning manner. I am getting old and don't always want to lean (especially when eating). It is nice to be able to adjust it in a more upright position but have the option to lean back, put my feet up, and take a nap (told you I am getting old).
review.name: Might Be the Best Backpacking Chair

review.reviewBody: Love this chair for every back packing trip! It weighs next to nothing, drys out fast if I want to sit in the creek, and is comfortable for reclining and putting my hankies up after a long hike. Also, we take this on our car camping trips for our kido and she loves it! Thanks guys! Love your products!
review.name: Worth its weight every trip

review.reviewBody: Nemo foud clever ways to shave weight from this very comfortable, packable design. easy adjustments, great way to stabilize the base. it's a winner1
review.name: the lightest version of a great design

review.reviewBody: This chair is great, it’s so small and light that sometimes I just leave it in my bike bag and forget about it.(I commute via bicycle)
review.name: Awesome, lightweight and packable

review.reviewBody: I was in the market for an ultralight chair I could carry with me backpacking. I originally tried the Moonlite before and while I liked it, it was not competitive in the weight dept. vs. other competitors. Then, by a stroke of luck, Nemo released the elite version of the Moonlite and I quickly made the purchase. Let me tell you I did not regret it. The chair is very comfortable for my 5'7 150lb frame. It's light, packs down pretty small and flat into itself, and takes up no room in my pack. Lastly, it has the option to recline some (a feature I didn't think I would enjoy as much as I do). I've taken it out on 3 trips so far and besides a little dust (which washed out easily) still looks brand new.
review.name: Nemo quality in an ultralight form factor

review.reviewBody: As a guide, I’m outdoors pretty much every day. The size/weight/comfort ratio is perfect. Stores in anything, glovebox, backpack, or boat box. I have the camo version, and it’s great for dove hunts. My advice is to try it before buying, but I’ve let friends of almost all sizes sit in it and most of them either order it right then or want to buy it. Great for ALL activities.
review.name: I carry this thing EVERYWHERE!!!

name: Moonlite Elite Reclining Camp Chair (Citron)

review.reviewBody: I have 5 pair of Silencr Pants.  I've worn these most days over the past 3 years.  I wear them at the office, backpacking and at pickelball.  They all are in great shape with no wear spots, rips, snags or any other failures.  The fit is great.  I love the cell phone open pocket.  I reach for my cell phone dozens of times a day.  I'm glad there is no snap or flap to get in the way.  My phone has never fallen out.
review.name: Pants look great after years of use.

review.reviewBody: Frequently purchase 30x30. Waist was way too small, length way too short. Will try a 32x32. Material seems legit. First pair of Kuhl’s.
review.name: Way too small

review.reviewBody: I bought the Silencer shorts which fit and feel amazing, I got the pants version.  As expected,  awesome!
review.name: Love Kuhl

review.reviewBody: I am an athletic build and the pants fit me well.  I understood the pants to have a durable stretch and “ripstop fabric.”  Unfortunately, the seams on the rear came undone and now there’s a huge hole in the back.  This definitely shouldn’t have happened w the pants fitting so well and my small butt.  I contacted Kuhl for repair and they denied my request.  I spent $100 on these cheap pants made in Vietnam that probably cost the company less than $20.  I’d buy pants at Walmart over getting another pair of Kuhls.  Don’t waste your money!
review.name: Seams came apart

review.reviewBody: Would give 5 stars but have only used a couple times so far (hiking) and have not yet put them through the wash. Always a challenge for a tall guy with athletic build to find a decent fit.  Listed as "full" fit, but Kuhl on their website correctly states that is is more of the athletic fit.  Older model, which does not have a lot of stretch fabric built in.  Have been using the shorts version several years now and love the durable fabric, washing never shrunk the fit.  Straight leg fit, not baggy, but not a slim jean fit either (my usual wear).  So, fits perfectly over low cut hiking shoes, but not quite over mid-height boots.  Length perfect for a tall guy.   Pockets ok, nothing special. A bit of room in the crotch, which works well to allow motion.   Light weight, really needed a base layer in walk today with temps in the 30's. Have other Kuhl gear and love the quality.
review.name: Great pants for tall, athletic build

review.reviewBody:
These pants are fantastic on a lot of levels but the "cell phone" pocket....
No pair of hiking pants should ever have an open pocket. Button flap. Always.
review.name: Great idea but sub par cell pocket

review.reviewBody: Ok cut, Ok material, and. All of the drawbacks of typical metal hardware, and none of the benefits. the waist button will not stay together, and its uncomfortably thick and sharp in the wrong places under a backpack.
review.name: Reasonably nice pants with bad hardware.
comment: Hey Simon!  Sorry to hear the pants didn't work for you.  Please don't hesitate to reach out to a Gearhead via chat or phone, we can help you out with a return or exchange as well as some recommendations for what might be a better option for you!

review.reviewBody: My husband loves these, I bought him all 3 colors since they were on sale! But he loves all kuhl pants
review.name: Kuhl pants are the best

review.reviewBody: These pants have fantastic materials and fit and a decent amount of features. The water resistance is marginal but they dry quickly. The pair I got had no size issues like other people seem to have. The reason these aren't my favorite is because of the absolutely terrible front button. It's some sort of weak circle aperture with zero clasping ability. It does not stay closed if any pressure is put on it. If it pops open then the whole zipper unzips immediately. If I unzip the zipper? The button snaps open with zero resistance. You are required to wear these with a belt. I'm tempted to just cut the thing off and replace it with a normal pants button. Considering what you pay for these it's a crime.
review.name: Almost excellent
comment: All kuhl pants have that closure, my husband wears them to work everyday and has had no issue with them

name: Silencr Pant - Men's

hasVariant.description: Buy the Aleck Nunchucks Audio & Communication Wireless Helmet Speaker online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

review.itemreviewed: Nunchucks Audio & Communication Wireless Helmet Speaker
review.reviewBody: The music quality is great for using while snowboarding! Volume has a good range, phone calls worked very smoothly. Overall, loved using these on the mountain this past season. The only thing I can complain about is, after a few hours they would start to hurt my ears. If your helmet is already a bit on the tight side around your ears, these may be a bit thick to fit comfortably for all day.
review.name: All around pretty good helmet speakers

review.itemreviewed: Nunchucks Audio & Communication Wireless Helmet Speaker
review.reviewBody: I wish this was a better story.  Purchased two (2) as pair in November 23 for upcoming ski season.  In short, the headset works O.K. with both my wife's Apple phone and my android, no issue.  The issue is with the actual headset.  The microphone although connecting during calls is so muted you must shout for the other person to hear anything.  Imagine how that looks inside the ski lodge cafe to attempt a call??  I've contacted Aleck about adjusting/fixing, etc..  NO RESPONSE.  Secondary, the volume adjustment in principle is a good idea, but in reality, doesn't work well.  You must cycle up and down and you can't tell the level b/c you don't know if it's starting up or down.  So that's a pain in the rear.  The sound is decent, but I liked OutdoorTech CHIPS 2.0 for sound quality better personally. I can make the google assistant work, but it's difficult and fiddly.  The PTT app and communication, well what little we've tried has been useless.  From what I can tell, the headset works as "advertised" but in reality, just isn't very good quality, hard to use, has some bugz.  Maybe that's just my experience and yours will be different??  Actually, going to return both and go back to CHIPs most likely.  We unfortunately put stickers on the box for identification of his/hers, so I don't think I can now.
review.name: Aleck Nunchucks, pair purchased together

review.itemreviewed: Nunchucks Audio & Communication Wireless Helmet Speaker
review.reviewBody: Bought a pair for my wife and me to try out. Skied 4 days with them trying to get them to work to no avail. We were in Heavenly which has good cell coverage throughout the resort, either she would be connected and i couldn't connect or vice versa. For the few times that we were both connected, we would have to make sure to mute them on the lifts when we were next to each other or would get serious feedback whenever one of us spoke to each other. Ended up returning them.
review.name: Not consistent, hard to connect

review.itemreviewed: Nunchucks Audio & Communication Wireless Helmet Speaker
review.reviewBody: These chips are functional and easy to use but lack the quality of a nice headphone. Also, even though they are meant to fit in all audio inserts they are a tight squeeze on my Smith Maze insert. No major complaints after 5 days on the mountain this season, but overall they could be louder, have better sound quality, ad fit easier into an insert.
review.name: Leaves a lot to desire...

name: Nunchucks Audio & Communication Wireless Helmet Speaker

review.itemreviewed: Aequilibrium LT GTX Mountaineering Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: Shame I didn?t have these for the last 10 years of PNW summer climbing. These are ideal for nearly every objective out there. Not sure they?ll work for winter climbs, but I?m keen to try. Light and actually fun for the approaches. Sufficiently stiff for easy-going terrain, potentially up to AI3. Beyond that, I?d go for something more robust. Size 48 in these feels a bit longer (but similarly wide) as my trusty old Nepal Evos - beware when adding insoles. For the price, these are great. American Alpine Institute, REI, and Feathered Friends often have these for even less than Backcountry.
review.name: Excellent mountaineering boots

review.itemreviewed: Aequilibrium LT GTX Mountaineering Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody:
As much as I had hoped to like these boots, they just didn?t work for me. The Vibram sole was too soft, not the hard rubber one is used to in a mountaineering boot. 
The fit was odd, no real ankle support, and felt like an LL Bean duck boot on steroids. 
They did look great, however, but just not the non insulated mountaineering boot I was after.
review.name: More of a snow boot

name: Aequilibrium LT GTX Mountaineering Boot - Men's

description: Buy the Wolf Tooth Components Waveform Aluminum Pedals online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Waveform Aluminum Pedals
hasVariant.description: Buy the Wolf Tooth Components Waveform Aluminum Pedals online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Waveform Aluminum Pedals
hasVariant.description: Buy the Wolf Tooth Components Waveform Aluminum Pedals online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
I like platform pedals and I cannot lie...

Maybe I am not skilled enough to use clip in pedals on my mountain bikes but I just find everything about them better.  This pedal is well made with a great wide platform that still gives me that ability to move my foot to a comfortable position at all times.  The spikes seem just right with good grip and no fighting the pedal when I need to move my foot.  Smooth spindles, not heavy, good clearance in tight turns.  For me I think about perfect.
review.name: Great Pedal

review.reviewBody: While hese pedals do not feel as locked in as the One Ups or T-Macs, I have never found them wanting in grip on steep and rough trails.  At the same time, for my riding they provide a better balance between ultimate grip and ability to quickly reposition my feet when I need to.  With both T-Macs and One Ups. I sometimes got distracted by having to completely lift my foot off the pedal to get it placed where I wanted - a situated that is not ideal if you are moving fast.
review.name: Goldilocks grip

review.reviewBody: Lightweight pedals that bite into the sole of the shoe for continuous contact in any situation.
review.name: Performance unequaled!

review.reviewBody: Used the pedals for three rides and now the left pedal spindle floats, creaks and cannot be tightened.  I was afraid something might have been wrong with these pedals to to the fact they were used when BC sent them to me.  I didn't spend $200 bucks for used pedals, but I thought "what could go wrong?".  Even though the pins were worn and the paint scratched off, I was still keen to give them a go.  I see now why they were returned.  Sadly, since I didn't even open the box until after the 30 days expired (due to back surgery -I couldn't ride)I may be out of luck on an exchange.  Have to give BC a 1 star for selling me used pedals for brand new prices and these pedals a 1 star for breaking so quickly.  They should have lasted much longer than this.  But I am a glutton for punishment (perhaps) since I like the brand and pedals, I may try another set of same.
review.name: Very Disappointed

review.reviewBody:
Purchased these after becoming frustrated having to rebuild my oneup aluminum pedals too frequently to avoid squeaking on the trail.  The waveform pedals seem to be of good build quality and certainly look nice but won't be for everybody.  After riding them for about a month, I have not adjusted completely to the narrower "q factor" of the pedal.  They still feel narrow on the bike.  Maybe I am just accustomed to a slightly wider stance on my flat pedals and I will adjust over time.  Despite the concavity of the platform and the plentiful pins, I do not feel that the waveforms are as grippy as the oneup aluminum pedals.  I have also noticed an increase in pedal strikes.  Apparently those few extra millimeters in thickness make a difference on my home trails.  This is completely subjective, of course, just one rider's experience. 
In short, the waveforms have a high quality build and are a solid choice, but narrower stance may be a turn off for some.
review.name: Yes, if...

name: Waveform Aluminum Pedals

review.reviewBody: Excellent engagement, solid feel, quick dual shifting, highly recommend!
review.name: Shimano XT shifter

review.reviewBody: dead shifting into easier gears.  broken internal spring as mentioned in another review. only six months of riding.
review.name: dead shift

review.reviewBody: The shifter itself works great and the setup looks super clean with the I-Spec EV sharing a clamp with the brake lever but the range of adjustability is not very good. I prefer to have my brake levers pretty far inboard  for easy one finger breaking and I have them angled downward for more XC style riding. With this brake orientation there is not enough range of motion in the I-spec adjustment to get the shifter in a good spot. I can barely reach the upshift with my index finger and I have to stretch my thumb pretty far backwards to reach the downshift which causes me to hold my bars funny and is resulting in a lot of thumb pain. I wish there was an option to adjust or swap the levers which would allow this to be a perfect setup but I'm probably going to have to by the bar clamp version to improve ergonomics and eliminate the severe thumb pain form having a less than ideal setup.
review.name: I-Spec EV Version Adjustability Sucks

name: XT SL-M8100 Trigger Shifters

review.reviewBody: The fit is so good and it's stretchy in the right spots! Plus a tad bit fleece-y on the inside
review.name: LOVE

review.reviewBody: I really like this jacket. I'm a road biker, not a mountain biker, but it works fairly well. I like the warmth of the fabric, and the stretchiness. The zipper is generous for cooling down. I didn't give it 5 stars because I wish it had a pocket on the right side instead of the left for right-handed people, I wish there were more than 1 pocket, and the fit is slightly snug under the arms--I went up a size from my normal size and it's still not as roomy as I'd ideally want. Also armpit zippers would be a nice addition for cooling, but not a must.
review.name: Nice Biking Jacket

review.reviewBody: Can't say enough about this piece, the fit is ideal for mountain biking (spring skiing, bike commuting, running errands, traveling, etc, etc). Some pullovers can feel constricting or tight, this is the perfect fit for biking, stretchy, and roomy enough to layer underneath. The length is ideal in the torso and the arms (I'm 5'6" and ordered the small). There is a slight fleece backing, which has me grabbing this pullover for spring ski days. On top of all of that, this hoodie is durable and weather resistant, so far have worn in a light sprinkle and the hoodie nicely shed the rain drops. So stoked on this technical pullover and cannot wait to wear for all my spring adventures! I purchased the caramel color, perfect for being seen when out on the road or trail.
review.name: LOVE, LOVE, LOVE for biking and beyond!

review.reviewBody: Perfect for anytime rain or shine. Light enough to pack anywhere. Can wear everyday. Fit is comfy and perfect.
review.name: LOVE THIS JACKET

review.reviewBody: This is a great warm layer for those cooler spring/end of fall day. It's warm enough to wear a short sleeve underneath. Also fashionable/comfortable enough to wear to the post ride beer!
review.name: A great layer on a windy day

review.reviewBody: From shoulder season at the bike park to spring conditions ski touring, I find myself reaching for this hoodie constantly. It's just the right weight to not be too warm, and the hood even fits under most of my helmets so that it's not flopping around everywhere. Fortunately, I haven't had to test how weatherproof it is, but I can say it does block wind pretty well, and the slight fleecy inside is super soft against my skin. All these things are great, but my overall favorite feature is the pocket. It's just the right size for my phone and small multitool, and its positioned just right on my left side that I barely notice it when I'm riding.
review.name: Love it!

review.reviewBody: I just got this hoodie in black and love it! The fit is great, although if you are between sizes I would size down. It has a roomy fit. I have used it for everything- biking, hiking, running, and x-country skiing. It's super easy to get on and off, and the hood is not too bulky. This is a great piece!
review.name: LOVE!

review.reviewBody: Great light weight jacket. I ordered a Medium and it is perfect. I’m 5’4” and 140 lbs. the sleeves are long as has been mentioned. No big deal just roll them up. Love the Jelly color. It makes me smile!
review.name: Happy in my Jelly jacket

review.reviewBody: My first word opening the package was "Yaaaaaas!" The color Jelly pink is SO bright pink, I'm so excited to have brights back in rotation. Medium fits my 5'7 frame perfectly. It's definitely an 'under' jacket, as the outermost fabric feels super thin (its silky smooth but does slightly show the filling inside in certain light.) Love!
review.name: Bright and cozy!

review.reviewBody: The packability and weight is great, but you can see the fill inside the coat through the fabric. Good for travel when you live in a warmer area!

This is my super SuperStrand LT jacket adventure! I went to Iceland where I thought June would be about 40-50 degrees. Surprise, surprise... when it was in the 20-30's most days with snow, wind blowing so hard it was hard to stand up sometimes...I wore this jacket every day under a second thin jacket and was so toasty warm I had no trouble hiking in the beautiful countryside. It packs easily and so small that my suitcase wasn't over-bulging either! LOVE, LOVE, LOVE it. My only regret is that I didn't get the one with the hood.
review.name: Definitely would buy this jacket again.

review.reviewBody: Packable, lightweight, relatively windproof. Love this jacket and have had lots of comments about it.
review.name: Love how lightweight this is

review.reviewBody: Fits perfectly on my daughter, great warmth level for in-between  Temps. Got her a medium fits xxl runs small . Bought 4 different  outdoor research jackets all xxl they fit this one did not.
review.name: Daughter likes it

review.reviewBody: Great everyday jacket also perfect to layer with if you're skiing or riding. Insanely warm for how lightweight it is.
review.name: Great lightweight jacket

review.reviewBody: This jacket is incredibly light weight, and fit well (5'3" 150lbs, medium). I didn't keep it because I decided I wanted the hooded version more. It's a great mid layer for really cold days, and warm enough to wear on its own until about -15°C
review.name: Decided I wanted a hood

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] is light and warm. But not sure the material will last long, because it is very thin.
review.name: great coat, but material is thin

review.reviewBody: I love the softness of the fabric and it's so light and comfy I sometimes use it as a sweater. It's roomy enough for layering yet not too loose as-is. I love the rhubarb color-thought it would be good for safe hiking in hunting season but I'm wearing it this spring because it's a happy red-orange color. Kind of like tulips in the sun!
review.name: I love this jacket!

name: SuperStrand LT Jacket - Women's
